Particle Swarm Intelligence#

Particle swarm optimization (PSO) is a stochastic optimization metaheuristic that is inspired by the movement of animals in swarms. A classic analogy to PSO metaheuristics is that of a flock of birds. Particles in PSO algorithms utilize social interaction to move towards the global optima. With this in mind, the most important components to investigate when customizing or designing your own PSO :class:`Algorithm`s are the position and velocity update components.

CIFY does not provide a huge array of PSO Algorithm`s, however, it provides the necessary functionality to implement many varieties of PSO :class:`Algorithm`s. All provided PSO :class:`Algorithm`s have default components and control parameters. When designing an :class:`Algorithm to optimize your chosen ObjectiveFunction, try different velocity update functions and adjust their control parameters to improve performance.

Algorithm#

class PSO(obj_func: ObjectiveFunction, swarms: Optional[List[Collection]] = None, n_particles=50, velocity_update=None, velocity_params=None, position_update=None, position_params=None, topology=None, topology_params=None, **kwargs)#

Bases: Algorithm

Defines a general PSO algorithm.

The only required parameters are an objective function (obj_func) of the type ObjectiveFunction and either, a list of swarms or a single swarm, or a number of particles (n_particles) to use in a swarm. If no swarms or number of particles is provided, a default swarm with 50 particles uniformly distributed within the objective function bounds will be created.

__init__(obj_func: ObjectiveFunction, swarms: Optional[List[Collection]] = None, n_particles=50, velocity_update=None, velocity_params=None, position_update=None, position_params=None, topology=None, topology_params=None, **kwargs)#
Parameters:

  • obj_func (ObjectiveFunction) – The ObjectiveFunction to be optimized.

  • swarms (list of :class:`Collection`s) – The swarms with which to optimize the ObjectiveFunction.

  • n_particles – The number of particles to use in a swarm for the supplied ObjectiveFunction if no swarms are provided, defaults to 50.

  • n_particles – int, optional

  • velocity_update (function, optional) – A velocity update function to use, defaults to default_vel_update.

  • velocity_params (dict, optional) – Any additional parameters for the velocity update function.

  • position_update (function, optional) – A position update function to use, defaults to default_pos_update.

  • position_params (dict, optional) – Any additional parameters for the position update function.

  • topology (function, optional) – A topology function for social best updates to be used, defaults to star_topology.

  • topology_params (dict, optional) – Any additional parameters for the topology function.

do_iteration()#

Performs a single iteration of the Algorithm.

class InertiaWeightPSO(obj_func: ObjectiveFunction, swarms: list, n_particles=None, velocity_params=None, position_update=None, position_params=None, topology=None, topology_params=None, **kwargs)#

Bases: PSO

The inertia weight PSO algorithm. Uses the inertia_weight_vel_update velocity update function.

__init__(obj_func: ObjectiveFunction, swarms: list, n_particles=None, velocity_params=None, position_update=None, position_params=None, topology=None, topology_params=None, **kwargs)#
Parameters:

  • obj_func (ObjectiveFunction) – The ObjectiveFunction to be optimized.

  • swarms (list of :class:`Collection`s) – The swarms with which to optimize the ObjectiveFunction.

  • n_particles – The number of particles to use in a swarm for the supplied ObjectiveFunction if no swarms are provided, defaults to 50.

  • n_particles – int, optional

  • velocity_params (dict, optional) – Any additional parameters for the velocity update function.

  • position_update (function, optional) – A position update function to use, defaults to default_pos_update.

  • position_params (dict, optional) – Any additional parameters for the position update function.

  • topology (function, optional) – A topology function for social best updates to be used, defaults to star_topology.

  • topology_params (dict, optional) – Any additional parameters for the topology function.

Particle#

class Particle(position=None, velocity=None, obj_func=None, **kwargs)#

Bases: Agent

Defines a Particle object for use in PSO.

Particle objects are at the core of any swarm-based optimization algorithm. When instantiating a Particle it is only necessary to supply an ObjectiveFunction to be optimized. The remaining fields will then be given default values appropriate for the ObjectiveFunction.

__init__(position=None, velocity=None, obj_func=None, **kwargs)#
Parameters:

  • position (Position or array-like, optional) – The initial position, defaults to a uniformly sampled vector within the bounds of the provided ObjectiveFunction.

  • velocity (Any array-like, optional) – The initial velocity.

  • obj_func (ObjectiveFunction) – The objective function used for evaluation and bounds by the Individual.

property position: Position#

Returns the position as a Position object.

property p_best_position: Position#

Returns the personal best position as a Position object.

property social_best_pos: Position#

Returns the social or neighbourhood best position as a Position object.

property velocity: ndarray#

Returns the current velocity as a Numpy array.

property obj_func: ObjectiveFunction#

Returns the ObjectiveFunction this Particle will be optimizing.

evaluate()#

Evaluates the Particle’s position.

satisfies_constraints()#

Checks whether the Particle satisfies the constraints of the passed ObjectiveFunction.

copy()#

Creates and returns a copy of the Particle object.

Returns:

A copy of the original particle object.

Return type:

Particle

Utilities#

get_swarm(n_particles=50, obj_func=None, n_dimensions=None, upper_bounds=None, lower_bounds=None, **kwargs) → Collection#

Returns a Collection, affectionately known as a swarm, of Particle objects.

Parameters:

  • n_particles (int, optional) – The number of :class:`Particle`s in the population, defaults to 50.

  • obj_func (ObjectiveFunction) – The ObjectiveFunction to generate a population of :class:`Particle`s for.

  • n_dimensions (int, optional) – The number of dimensions of the ObjectiveFunction search space, used when generating position vectors for each Particle in the population. If an ObjectiveFunction is provided and this field is not populated, defaults to the number of dimensions of the ObjectiveFunction. If no ObjectiveFunction is provided, defaults to 10.

  • upper_bounds (float or array-like of floats, optional.) – An array or scalar value representing the upper bounds to initialize particles within. If an ObjectiveFunction is provided, the particles will be uniformly distributed within the bounds of the ObjectiveFunction.

  • lower_bounds (float or array-like of floats, optional.) – An array or scalar value representing the lower bounds to initialize particles within. If an ObjectiveFunction is provided, the particles will be uniformly distributed within the bounds of the ObjectiveFunction.

Returns:

A swarm of particles.

Return type:

Collection of :class:`Particle`s

get_swarms(n_swarms=3, n_particles=50, n_dimensions=10, obj_func=None, upper_bounds=None, lower_bounds=None, **kwargs) → List[Collection]#

Returns a list of Collection`s of :class:`Particle objects. In other words, a list of swarms.

Parameters:

  • n_swarms (int, optional) – The number of swarms to return, defaults to 3.

  • n_particles (int or list of ints, optional) – The number of particles in each swarm or all swarms, defaults to 50.

  • n_dimensions (int or list of ints, optional) – The number of dimensions of the ObjectiveFunction search space, used when generating position vectors for each particle in the swarm. If an ObjectiveFunction is provided, this field will not be used.

  • obj_func (ObjectiveFunction) – The ObjectiveFunction to generate swarms of :class:`Particle`s for.

  • upper_bounds (float or array-like of floats, optional) – An array or scalar value representing the upper bounds to initialize particles within.

  • lower_bounds (float or array-like of floats, optional) – An array or scalar value representing the lower bounds to initialize particles within.

Returns:

A list of swarms for the given ObjectiveFunction.

Return type:

list of Collection objects

Velocities#

default_vel_update(particle: Particle, c1=1.4, c2=1.4, **kwargs)#

The default velocity update function.

Parameters:

  • particle (Particle) – The particle whose velocity is to be updated.

  • c1 (float) – The first acceleration coefficient, defaults to 1.4.

  • c2 (float) – The second acceleration coefficient, defaults to 1.4.

inertia_weight_vel_update(particle: Particle, w=0.72, c1=1.4, c2=1.4, **kwargs)#

Inertia weight velocity update.

Parameters:

  • particle (Particle) – The particle whose velocity is to be updated.

  • w (float) – The weight component of the inertia weight update, defaults to 0.72.

  • c1 (float) – The first acceleration coefficient, defaults to 1.4.

  • c2 (float) – The second acceleration coefficient, defaults to 1.4.

deterministic_iw_vel_update(particle: Particle, w=0.72, c1=1.4, c2=1.4, **kwargs)#

Inertia weight velocity update without stochastic variables.

Parameters:

  • particle (Particle) – The particle whose velocity is to be updated.

  • w (float) – The weight component of the inertia weight update, defaults to 0.72.

  • c1 (float) – The first acceleration coefficient, defaults to 1.4.

  • c2 (float) – The second acceleration coefficient, defaults to 1.4.

constriction_coefficient_vel_update(particle: Particle, k=1.0, c1=1.4, c2=1.4, **kwargs)#

Velocity update function based on using a constriction coefficient. Uses the control parameter k to represent the constriction coefficient.

Parameters:

  • particle (Particle) – The particle whose velocity is to be updated.

  • k (float) – The weight component of the inertia weight update, defaults to 1.0.

  • c1 (float) – The first acceleration coefficient, defaults to 1.4.

  • c2 (float) – The second acceleration coefficient, defaults to 1.4.
